Professional Foundation Crack Repair in Toronto

Don't let small cracks become big problems

Foundation cracks are a serious concern that require immediate professional attention. Our certified technicians specialize in permanent crack repair solutions that address both the symptom and the underlying cause. Using advanced injection techniques and materials, we ensure your foundation remains structurally sound and watertight.

Actively Leaking Crack?

Water coming through your foundation crack needs immediate attention. Our emergency team is available 24/7.

Call Now: (437) 545-0067 - Average response time: 45 minutes

Types of Foundation Cracks We Repair

Each crack type requires a specific repair approach

Vertical Cracks

Most common type caused by settlement. Polyurethane injection ideal. Same-day repair available.

Horizontal Cracks

Step Cracks

Diagonal Cracks

Indicate differential settlement, common in corners. Require proper diagnosis.

Active Leaking Cracks

Structural Cracks

Understanding Crack Repair Costs

Transparent pricing with no hidden fees

Foundation crack repair costs vary based on several factors:

Typical Pricing

  • â€¢ Single vertical crack: $500-$1,000
  • â€¢ Multiple cracks: $1,500-$3,500
  • â€¢ Structural repairs: $2,000-$5,000
  • â€¢ Emergency service: Additional $200-$500

Repair Methods

  • â€¢ Polyurethane injection: $500-$1,500/crack
  • â€¢ Epoxy injection: $600-$1,800/crack
  • â€¢ Exterior excavation: $1,500-$3,500/crack
  • â€¢ Carbon fiber: $800-$2,000/crack

Factors Affecting Cost

Crack Length & Width

Longer and wider cracks require more injection material and preparation

Accessibility

Hard-to-reach areas may increase labor time and complexity

Repair Method Required

Polyurethane, epoxy, or carbon fiber reinforcement affects pricing

Structural Concerns

Load-bearing walls or active movement require specialized solutions

Save Money

Bundle multiple crack repairs for discounts up to 20%. We also offer 0% financing for repairs over $1,000.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is crack injection a permanent fix?

Yes, when properly done. Our polyurethane injection creates a flexible, waterproof seal that moves with your foundation. Combined with our 25-year warranty, you can trust the repair will last.

Can I paint over the repaired crack?

Absolutely. Once cured, the injection ports are removed and the surface is smoothed. You can paint, apply waterproofing coatings, or finish your basement walls as desired.

Do you repair cracks in block foundations?

Yes, we repair cracks in both poured concrete and concrete block foundations. Block foundations may require a different approach, but we have solutions for all foundation types.

What if the crack is actively leaking?

Active leaks are our specialty. We use fast-setting polyurethane that can stop flowing water immediately. Our emergency team is available 24/7 for urgent leak situations.

When to Call Immediately

Urgent Warning Signs

  • â€¢ Active water leaking
  • â€¢ Crack wider than 1/4 inch
  • â€¢ Horizontal cracks
  • â€¢ Multiple new cracks
  • â€¢ Visible wall movement
